page.title: 16TOP FARM MUSEUM
page.content: {Top Farm agricultural museum}is situated in 17 acres of land in West Hardwick and was until recently part of the{Nostell Priory Estate.}The present owner, Mr Duckitt,gave up farming 6 years ago to concentrate full time on the museum. To help support the enterprise he also holds regular barn dances. There are many interesting items on display at the museum, revealing Mr Duckitts enthusiasm for our agricultural past.The exhibits include old scythes, beet knives, pitch forks, ploughs, sickles and even an old combine harvester which dates back to about 1800. The harvester is operated by a traction engine which is also on display.
